meanings.definition: A person who engages in illegal business activities, typically involving extortion or fraud.
meanings.sent1: The racketeer was arrested for running a scam.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the racketeer red-handed during a shady deal.
meanings.sent3: The racketeer tried to trick people into giving him money, but he got caught!
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood was plagued by the racketeer's deceitful schemes.
meanings.sent5: The notorious racketeer was known for his cunning ways of swindling others.

meanings.definition: To engage in dishonest or illegal business activities, typically involving extortion or fraud.
meanings.sent1: He decided to racketeer by selling counterfeit goods.
meanings.sent2: The criminals racketeered by threatening small businesses.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends joked that they would racketeer their way to riches.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt politician was known to racketeer for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The con artist racketeered his way into the trust of unsuspecting victims.
